Literature Review: Mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) plays a crucial role in cellular energy production and has recently been recognized as a significant player in innate immune signaling. The release of mtDNA from mitochondria can trigger various immune responses, contributing to both physiological and pathological conditions. This literature review explores the mechanisms of mtDNA release, its activation of innate immune sensors, and its implications in human diseases, infections, and aging.
